intro: Polypodium barisanicum, commonly known as the Barisan fern, is a species of polypodioid fern native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped fronds that are typically 30–60 cm in length. The plant produces spores in clusters on the underside of its fronds, which are released during the wet season. It thrives in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and mountainous regions. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
